prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] Next, move on to creating the sketch. We will be working on face_1 with the following loop: * Loop_1: Line_1, Line_2, Line_3, Line_4 Here are the length and width of the lines: * Line_1: starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.5, 0.0]; * Line_2: starts at [0.5, 0.0] and ends at [0.5, 0.5]; * Line_3: starts at [0.5, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.5]; * Line_4: starts at [0.0, 0.5] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]; With a sketch scale of 0.5, extrude the sketch with the following properties: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.125 * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.125 Please note that this is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation," meaning it will be a separate object from any existing bodies. The resulting shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. The dimensions of this shape are: * Length: 0.5 * Width: 0.25 * Height: 0.5 Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional slightly tapered rectangular prism Create a new coordinate system for this part: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.25, 0.0, 0.5] We will be working with a single face_1 and the following loop: * Loop_1: Line_1, Line_2, Line_3, Line_4 Here are the coordinates for the lines: * Line_1: starts at [0.0, 0.0] and ends at [0.25, 0.0]; * Line_2: starts at [0.25, 0.0] and ends at [0.25, 0.25]; * Line_3: starts at [0.25, 0.25] and ends at [0.0, 0.25]; * Line_4: starts at [0.0, 0.25] and ends at [0.0, 0.0]; With a sketch scale of 0.25, it's time to extrude the sketch: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.25 * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 This operation is a "JoinFeatureOperation" indicating that it will connect with the previous body. The resulting shape will be a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Here are the dimensions: * Length: 0.25 * Width: 0.25 * Height: 0.25 This concludes the instructions for constructing the two parts. The final shape is a three-dimensional geometric shape resembling a rectangular base and triangular top connected by a straight line.</description>
